hc696_9 wrote:

> Hi again...
>
> I'm looking for methodes from Heritrix 1.2. Actualy I'm searching a
> alternative methode for org.archive.crawler.datamodel.CrawlUri "public
> void addLinkToCollection(String link, String collectionName)".

Just before the 1.4.0 release, the Link class was introduced.  See 
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/index.html.  Notice how Link attempts 
encapsulation of all to do w/ Link.  See how it references page it was 
found in, what the actual link URL is, its 'type' and 'context', etc.

Rather than carry extracted links as Strings in the CrawlURI, with each 
link type carried in its own 'collection', now CrawlURI carries a single 
collection of Link objects. The CrawlURI API was changed accordingly. 
See from about 
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/datamodel/CrawlURI.html#1080 
on for the new versions of old link-adding methods. Alternatives to 
addLinkToCollection are the methods addOutlink, createAndAddLink, etc.

Study ExtractorHTML#processLink, how its called, for how to add Links to 
a CrawlURI.


>
> Second question: what happend to the CoreAttributeConstants
> A_CSS_LINKS, A_HTML_EMBEDS, A_HTML_LINKS, A_HTML_SPECULATIVE_EMBEDS,
> A_HTTP_HEADER_URIS and A_JS_FILE_LINKS ? any alternatives?

These are no longer needed now all links are stored in a single 
collection inside CrawlURI.

>
> Third question: In Class CrawlURI the Methode
> public Link getPrerequisiteUri() {
>         return (Link) getObject(A_PREREQUISITE_URI);
>     }
> returns a Link. How can I get the prerequisitURI from this Linkobject?
> By using the Methode Link.getDestination() or Link.getSource() ?

Source is where the link was found.  Destination is the actual Link URL.

>
> Sorry for all this questions, but I have to update not selfe written
> code, not that funny :) ... (a specialised webcrawler for
> www.geometa.info)

No problem.  Keep asking questions.

St.Ack
P.S. Any chance you'd want to write a sentence on how/what geometa is 
using Heritrix for and I'll add it to our list of Heritrix users out on 
the FAQ?  You can send it to me off the list.

>
> Thanks for your help, Adrian
